sentence.Network_en: He was critical of the people, disparaging of their crude manners.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对那些人很有看法，看不起他们粗俗的举止。

sentence.Network_en: The Minister was alleged to have made disparaging remarks about the rest of the Cabinet.
sentence.Network_cn: 据说这位部长发表了一些贬低其他内阁成员的言论。

sentence.Network_en: Halliday's comments grew daily more and more sparklingly disagreeable and disparaging.
sentence.Network_cn: 一天天过去,哈里代的评论越来越肆无忌惮,越来越讨人嫌,越来越阴损了.

list.abs: its an institute you cant disparage ., 你自己学会斜面贬.

used as a disparaging term for a white person .对白人一种贬损的字眼。

entry.def: If you are disparaging about someone or something, or make disparaging comments about them, you say things which show that you do not have a good opinion of them.

example.ex: He was critical of the people, disparaging of their crude manners...
example.tran: 他对那些人很有看法，看不起他们粗俗的举止。

example.ex: The Minister was alleged to have made disparaging remarks about the rest of the Cabinet.
example.tran: 据说这位部长发表了一些贬低其他内阁成员的言论。

auth_sentence.content: I will certainly never be disparaging about family history again.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: I will certainly never be disparaging about family history again.
